sources.title: Vengeance
sources.description: Title: Vengeance Summary: Tom's parents are killed by Mexican outlaws after their leader (Van Cleef) rapes his mother as he watched. He sets out to exact revenge and is ultimately helped by a successful gold prospector who has been robbed by the same outlaws. Directed by: Joseph Manduke Actors: Lee Van Cleef, Jim Brown, John Marley Production Company: Golan-Globus Productions Release Date: August 1977 (USA) Aspect Ratio: REMOVE_TAG Tom's parents are killed by Mexican outlaws after their leader (Van Cleef) rapes his mother as he watched. He sets out to exact revenge and is ultimately helped by a successful gold prospector who has been robbed by the same outlaws.

metadata.Plot: Having witnessed the brutal murder of his father, the horrific sexual assault of his mother, and the abduction of his innocent young sister by McClain's ruthless gang of cut-throats, Tom, the lucky fifteen-year-old survivor, swears revenge. Hell-bent on making them pay in blood, Tom embarks on a life-or-death quest to avenge his family, relentlessly pursuing the leader and his jackals in the unforgiving desert. As Tom crosses paths with Isaac, a compassionate prospector who has reasons to see McClain and his bandits suffer, he sets in motion his deadly campaign, methodically picking the perpetrators off with his ingenious traps. Is one ever too young for vengeance?
metadata.Writer: Bud Robbins, James Telfer, Ken Globus
metadata.Actors: Lee Van Cleef, Jim Brown, John Marley
